body:
Fill in the C100 form to [apply for a court order](https://www.gov.uk/looking-after-children-divorce/apply-for-court-order) and send it to your nearest family court. It costs £215 to apply.

(i) You must give a brief summary of your position and what you want to achieve from the hearing. This is sometimes known as a ‘position statement’.

You’ll need to make a separate application if you wish to discuss any other issues in court (for example your finances).
The court will set a date for a First Hearing Dispute Resolution Appointment (FHDRA). It’ll take about 4 weeks after you apply to get a date.

An advisor from the [Children and Family Court Advisory and Support Service (Cafcass)](https://www.cafcass.gov.uk/default.aspx) will provide a report before the first hearing.

A Cafcass report includes:

- a social services and criminal record check on you and the other parent
- details of your family’s current arrangements
- a summary of any other issues the court needs to be aware of

Cafcass will also contact you before the first hearing with more information about what to do on the day.

[Watch video for more details](#c_video_player)
cost_description: Only applicant needs to pay the fee.
